text:
Borough Place, east from Bay Street, showing the gate and wall of the United States Lighthouse Department grounds.

May 5, 1929

P. L. Sperr

St. George, Staten Island, showing Staten Island's ferry and railroad terminals as seen in a northerly direction from 30 Bay Street.

In view 1, from right to left, are shown the following: the ramp leading down to St George-Brooklyn ferry landing, the terminal of the Staten Island Rapid Transit system, the St. George-Manhattan terminal and the ramp leading up to it from Bay Street, the Baltimore & Ohio freight yards, and a portion of the Richmond Borough Hall.  In the background is the Manhattan skyline.

Views 2 and 3 are in a more easterly direction, towards Brooklyn.  In the lower right-hand corners of these views is the U.S. Lighthouse Station, at the S.E. corner of Bay Street and Borough Place.

View 1, 2: April 29, 1929
View 3: March 5, 1939

P.L. Sperr

View 3: March 5, 1939

P.L. Sperr

Stuyvesant Place, north from Hyatt Street (left), showing (right), part of the Richmond Borough Hall, the Richmond County Court House and the Macgregor Arms Apartments. The 2½- story frame house, in the center of the view, is the old house of the Staten Island Institute of Arts and Sciences.

P. L. Sperr

April 29, 1929

Hyatt Street, north side, between Stuyvesant Place and St. Marks Place. The St. George Theatre occupies the left corner of the building. In the left background appears the Brighton Heights Reformed Church.

March 5, 1930.

P. L. Sperr

(1)
Bay Street, east side, south from but not including Borough Place to Slosson Terrace. On the cleared area was later erected the St. George Station of the United States Post Office. The building in the background is the Staten Island Chamber of Commerce Bldg.
Oct. 22, 1931

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same location, at a later date, showing the new post office. Oct. 1936.

P. L. Sperr

(3)
Viewing the post office in the opposite direction (northward).

15 Hyatt Street, north side, adjoining the N.W. corner of Stuyvesant Street, showing the St. George branch of the Staten Island Savings Bank.

June, 1937

P. L. Sperr

St. George, Staten Island, showing Staten Island's ferry and railroad terminals as seen in a northerly direction
from 30 Bay Street.

In view 1, from right to left, are shown the following: the ramp loading down to St. George-Brooklyn ferry landing, the terminal of the Staten Island Rapid Transit system, the St. George- Manhattan terminal and the ramp leading up to it from Bay Street, the Baltimore and Ohio freight yards, and a portion of the Richmond Borough Hall. In the background
is the Manhattan skyline.

Views 2 and 3 are in a more easterly direction, toward Brooklyn. In the lower right-hand corners of these views is the U. S. Lighthouse Station, at the S. E. corner
of Bay Street and Borough Place.

Views 1, 2: April 29, 1929
View 3: March 5, 1939
